net.sf.kdgcommons.io

Class IOUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.kdgcommons.io.IOUtil

  • public class IOUtil
extends Object
    Static utility methods for working with classes in the java.io and java.nio packages.

    • Method Detail

      • closeQuietly

        public static void closeQuietly(Closeable closable)
        Closes any Closeable object, swallowing any exception that it might throw. This is used in a finally block, where such exceptions would supercede any thrown from code in the try block.

        This method also exists in Apache Commons IO. It exists here because older versions of Commons IO took explicit stream types, rather than Closeable.

        Parameters:
        closable - The object to close. May be null, in which case this method does nothing.

      • copy

        public static long copy(InputStream in,
                        OutputStream out)
                 throws IOException
        Copies the input stream to the output stream, leaving both open. Either parameter may be null, in which case this method does nothing.

        This method also exists (with many variants) in Jakarta Commons IO. It's here so that this library can be self-contained.

        Returns:
        The number of bytes copied.
        Throws:
        IOException
        Since:
        1.0.2

      • openFile

        public static InputStream openFile(File file)
                            throws IOException
        Opens a file, applying common delegates. The returned stream is buffered, and if file's name ends in ".gz" it's wrapped with a .

        If any step fails, the underlying file will be closed (preventing leakage of file descriptors).

        Throws:
        IOException

      • openFile

        public static InputStream openFile(String fileName)
                            throws IOException
        Opens a file, applying common delegates. The returned stream is buffered, and if file's name ends in ".gz" it's wrapped with a .

        If any step fails, the underlying file will be closed (preventing leakage of file descriptors).

        Throws:
        IOException

      • createTempFile

        public static File createTempFile(String prefix,
                                  long size)
                           throws IOException
        Creates a temporary file in the default temporary-file directory. Unlike the similarly-named method in File, this method adds a shutdown hook to delete the file, always uses the suffix ".tmp", and will create files of arbitrary size. The content of the file are undefined, per contract of RandomAccessFile.setLength().
        Parameters:
        prefix - The prefix used to construct the file's name. Must be at least three characters long (per File API).
        size - The size of the file, in bytes.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • createTempFile

        public static File createTempFile(InputStream in,
                                  String prefix)
                           throws IOException
        Creates a temporary file via createTempFile(java.lang.String, long), then copies the contents of the passed stream to it. The input stream will be closed, whether or not the method completed normally (including cases where the file could not be created).
        Throws:
        IOException
        Since:
        1.0.2

      • readFully

        public static int readFully(InputStream in,
                            byte[] dest)
                     throws IOException
        Repeatedly reads the passed stream, until either the buffer is full or EOF is reached. Returns the number of bytes actually read.

        The stream will not be closed by this method, even if EOF is reached.

        Throws:
        IOException
        Since:
        1.0.4

      • skipFully

        public static long skipFully(InputStream in,
                             long bytesToSkip)
                      throws IOException
        Repeatedly calls skip() on the underlying stream, until either the desired number of bytes have been read or EOF is reached. Returns the number of bytes actually skipped.
        Throws:
        IOException
        Since:
        1.0.8
